pkgmetadata.longdescription: Analyze Big Files Without Loading Them in Memory // A simple set of wrapper functions for data.table::fread() that allows subsetting or filtering rows and selecting columns of table- formatted files too large for the available RAM. 'b stands for 'big files'. The package is using Unix commands like grep, cut and sed through (hopefully) intuitive parameters. IMPORTANT: On Windows environments, you need to have those Unix commands available in your "PATH". The easiest way is to install "RTools". Alternatively, Git or Cygwin should also work if their /bin/ folders are in your Path.
